column4: Are there any big repos other than the ones selectable by default in Edgy?
you mean ones that we know will work for you or just big
both really, "dangerous" ones are ok for apps that aren't system critical dependencies
i mean with all the stuff ya can put in
there is a page somewhere, sec
if you google 'color prompt bash' you will get lots of links for cool prompt stuff
write an ubuntu howto when you get back - pass on the gift
erm, this is pretty much the same as before, but just in colour now so it's easier to spot
there is the hazard of making a prompt that takes 5 lines :)

i have all the color stuff enables so grep hilights, vi highlights and every other pgm that knows color highlights.  i consider that and the programmable auto-complete to be the best things that ever happened to the commandline
do you know what integration testing is?  how can the OO ppl test the integration in every distribution?
ubuntu is a production system, not a leading edge one - any change to any code is a retest
True, I just thought with packages being "fixed" so to speak there is less to go wrong than on a compile based system
i don't see what the difference is, with a robust build system delivering source is pretty much the same as delivering executables.  it all still needs testing appropriate to the user base
your first sentence puts you in a paradox - reliable and new are usually mutually exclusive :)
I guess that's why I liked Gentoo... when it actually worked, but the compile times and breakages eventually wore me down.
